Well, some junk, some stalker's gear for dummies.
Okay, to hell with it. Here's a reward - it's not much, but:
Yeah, it's real junk. Okay, hand it over. You can keep the book, it's of no use to me.
Wait, what about the reward?
Here, take it:
Colonel, do you need the briefcase?
Are you kidding? You've found it? Give it here.
Let's do this way: I'll give you the case in exchange for five "grand".
Another damn "businessman". Alright, here's your five "grand".
Here you go, I don't mind.
You're a good man, Marked One. Here, take a few grenades, they'll come in handy.
Your men just stripped me of everything and threw me in the jail.
Who exactly are you accusing?
Major Zhivoderov.
Ah, you know him... Very intelligent fellow. Neither he nor any of his men would beat you. Anyway, he has reported everything to me during the routine meeting.
But I wasn't going to steal anything! Something of mine was in that box!

Well, who do you think I should believe: the son of a colleague, whom I've known from our childhood, or you? We'll do it this way. If you really want your confiscated goods returned, I'll give you a chance to prove that they are really yours.
I don't need to prove to Duty, what is, or isn't mine...
Well, do you want to get your stuff back or don't you?
Of course I do.

Then listen carefully to what I have to say. The fact is, this area itself is neutral territory. Anyone who calls himself a stalker can come here and trade. Except for the most obvious thugs, of course, for whom there's a reward on their heads. And except for Freedom, obviously... So, there is a problem. A bandit named Caligula has appeared in the Zone recently. At first he traded the little trifle he stole from rookies at the Cordon, and then he decided to pull in the "big fish". He hammered together a gang and started to attack our squads. He'd grab their equipment and loot and the prisoners were sometimes tortured, but more often, they'd be shot. We started to hunt for him and killed all his accomplices, but we never got Caligula himself.
You didn't have enough men?
Don't interrupt me! In short, it's not so simple dealing with this skinhead. The fact is, Caligula has the nerve to come here, to the Bar, drink here and even sell goods stolen from our soldiers!
How can this happen?

Very simple: Barkeep has some secret agreement with him. We can't just arrest the bandit while he's in the Bar - that would quarrel us with Barkeep. He would survive without us, his main clients are stalkers with artifacts, but we need him more than he needs us... In general, this Caligula is really ruining our lives, and even mocking us. You have to kill him, Marked One.
So General, you have decided to make me your proxy. What if Barkeep gets wind of the deal?
He won't. You have to arrange everything as if it were your own doing, you understand?
Not really...

You need to somehow offend or insult this Caligula, so he'll challenge you to showdown. Shooting in the Bar is strictly forbidden, therefore you'll have to deal with him in the Arena. That's where you can safely kill him. Nobody will suspect anything.
Okay. Where can I find Caligula?
No, I won't do it.
He'll be in the 100 Rads Bar. Go and do it. If the bandit dies - you get your things back safely.
Where did you get the idea, watching Mad Max movies?
No, why do you ask?
The story is similar... Okay, here goes nothing.
And who are you?
Oh, just looking.
I know your face from somewhere...
So, get the fuck out of here.
What did you say?
I just remembered, you're the local Gigolo named Vaska Slutsky, the Zone's finest... Well, piss off, your place is in the brothel!
Oh you bitch, you're dead meat! Right, let's go to the Arena now, and sort this out!
Come on, I'll pluck out your feathers.
Choose, scumbag, which weapon do you want to use: pistols or sawn-off shotguns?
Pistols.
Knives.
Sawn-off shotguns.
What now, general? Caligula is dead.
Stalker, I'm very grateful, but listen...
Let me guess: my things are gone as payment for their storage?
Nothing is gone anywhere, just wait...
Did Barkeep find out about our affairs?
No. Zhivoderov got into trouble! He has your stuff.
What happened to him? To clarify: I'm only interested because he has my stuff.
Got deep into some shit. My soldiers are trying to pull him out, but to no avail.
Just like in that fairy tale, "The Giant Turnip"?
Consider this, Zhivoderov is the only one who knows the location of your items. And if you save the major, you'll also get a reward from me.
I'll help him.
To hell with your major.

Well, I see that you're a real man! His batman reported to me that the major had found something dangerous in the old cracked tower, right across from our base. He's been trapped in there as if inside an anomaly. Help him, stalker, he's very valuable to me! My soldiers have been there, but for some reason, they can do nothing. Go to him!
Well, as you wish, stalker...
You're from the General, aren't you?!
Yes, what happened?

Here's the problem: the Major entered this fucking tower, but now he can't get out. I've called and called him, and he doesn't come. Then private Brill went in after him but never returned. I went in after Brill, but he was not breathing by the time I approached him. If we can't rescue the Major, the General will tear off my skin. Be a man - help me save the Major.
If the private is dead, what makes you think that the Major is still alive?
Listen. You can hear moans coming from the top of the tower.
Did you try wearing a suit with psy-protection?
I tried, but the stupid suit failed, it doesn't work!
Fuck knows what to do now.
And who are you?
I'm the one who knows how to get the Duty soldier out of the tower.
You do?
Believe me, I also know why that dickhead happened to be there. The bastard tried to rummage through my stash.
Go on.

I returned to the Bar from Yantar to guzzle the money from the proceeds of my loot. Then this Zhivoderov, drunk as a lord, came up to me and said, that as long as he and his men were guarding me from the bandits, so I was to pay him for. I asked if he would take my loot as payment. When he agreed I then told him about my cache on the top tier of the tower. In there, I hid a single unknown artifact, and something else. The scientists at Yantar hadn't got interested in that artifact as it had no properties, but I figured that before the Major worked out what's what, I'd be long gone from the Bar.
Zhivoderov fell for it. So what happened then?
He climbed the tower and left his men on lookout. Then they tried to pull him out, but failed. And then you came along... Were you instructed to save him?
Yes. You said that you know how to do it.

It's necessary to disable the scientific device that he took out of my cache. You see, in addition to the artifact, I also hid some device there, that I had stolen from the scientists. Don't you look at me that way! They can order a new one for themselves, no problem, and I'll have just enough for of a pack of smokes... Win-win, so to say. So, I didn't touch the device, I just put it in there. Apparently, the Major rummaged through my cache for the artifact and came across the device and switched it on out of curiosity. And now it's affecting his brain. It's necessary to turn that device off, then the field will be gone.
Why is the Major still alive, and his assistant has died?
Fuck knows, maybe because every brain is different. My stalker instinct suggests that this artifact he took from my cache, is somehow protecting him.
Maybe. What do you advise?

Just switch off the device, damn it! Nothing else I can think of. Although... I have an idea. While I was at the Cordon, my friend Tolik gave me a bottle of the locally brewed moonshine. He said they called it "Kordonovsky". This bastard packs a punch - it will really numb your brain! So I'm thinking: fight fire with fire, as they say. Drink it and rush to the device. The main thing is to stall for time, before your brain begins to boil. What do you think? Will you try?
I don't drink!
Come on, it can't hurt.
H-help me! Turn it off!
Wait a second!
Look, how do I turn off this damn device?
I wish I knew. There was a manual with it, but the instructions were so complicated that I used the pages for cigarette papers.
Well, you blockhead! How am I going to turn it off then?
Wait, calm down. Before I used it all up, I did read something.
Tell me, what did you understand?

Although I'm not an electrician, I did realize something. The manual mentioned something about an overload: it said, to prevent it, a certain button must not be depressed, or the device will burn out.
There're lots of buttons.

This is what I remember: "...to reach the correct maximum load output it's necessary to press down the buttons alternately, so as to increase the power of the first phase first, then proceed to the second phase alternately pressing all the buttons, except the last one." So, if you click the last button, the damn thing will get overloaded.
Apparently, it's necessary to press the three side buttons in turn, and then click the lower left button, then go back and press all the three side buttons again?
Don't ask me that! I don't know, I never used the device! It's just what I've read...
If not for your greedy hands, this problem wouldn't have appeared. However, it's in my best interests to save that Dutier in the tower.
Listen, do you know how to turn off the unit in the tower?
Nah. Had I studied engineering in Kiev, as my parents wanted me to, maybe I could suggest something.
The Major is safe, I shut down the device.

Well, thank you, stalker! Listen... Can you tell the General that I helped a little, just a teeny bit, in saving the Major in the tower? He might give me a new weapon, or maybe, award me with a medal.
We'll see.
Any orders?
What fucking orders, I have a splitting headache... Let's get out of here.
Okay.
I rescued your Major.

Stalker, you are a true man of honour! I understand your desire to get even with him. What he did to you was a personal insult. Now I know that you would not steal from Duty's caches - your actions speak of that. By the way, how did it go with Caligula?
I guess I know why your soldiers couldn't overcome him. He possessed an artifact with strong protective properties.
The way it was supposed to. He's dead and can't hurt anyone else.

Stalker, I ... I mean our group needs this artifact! We need to pass it on to the scientists, this will help them in the development of protective combat armour. Sell it to me. I'll give you a hundred thousand.
Here's your reward then for everything you've done.
That's not enough.
I agree.
Don't be arrogant, that's 10 times more than any rare artifact of any kind is worth!
It has properties that make it worth more.
One hundred thousand and our top body armour.
No deal.
A hundred thousand, our top suit and a machine gun with a hundred rounds.
That's quite another matter.
Don't take me for a sucker.
Agreed!
Well then, piss off out of here with that rock! I thought you were an honest man, but you're just a huckster.
I hope your head has cleared enough, so you can remember where you put my stuff?
Enough... Besides your belongings, take this artifact in gratitude:
Thanks.
Greetings to you, stalker.
Are you Tail? Tell me, where do I find one of your friends - Kolya?
What a smart-ass. And what is it you need from him?
I was asked by Chebu... Uh-uh, I owe him some money, I want to give it back.
Ah, stalker, you can keep the money. I don't think you'll ever find Kolya.
Why's that? What happened to him?

He went to the north. Not to Freedom, but to undiscovered places. He was constantly tormented, and frequently had nightmares. He was always muttering about the creatures of the Zone, calling them astral beings, the quintessence of the human information field. Nonsense, in general. Poor guy... No one really understood him. Everyone thought he had gone crazy during one of his raids. But I saw that his mind was clear, though he really believed those things. That subject - we never talked about it. Then one day he packed up and left. He mentioned nothing to anyone, just whispered to me when parting: "I must find him, he will be THERE again, I know it."
Who was he looking for?
I don't know. Well, whoever it was, no one ever returned from those places.
And where exactly was he going?

To the north, that's all I can say. Kolya was the only one from locals who had been there. There are legends about that place, it's called the Dead City. It's dangerous out there... Life is worth more than any artifact. Don't think about going there to look for him - you'll disappear as well.
Well, as you can see, I'm not a rookie.
No, you're not a rookie, but a fool. But why should I care? Go wherever you want.
Hmm, thank you for your encouraging words.

Hey, stalker, don't be offended. It's a bad idea to go there. But if you've made up your mind, it's your business then. If you happen to find Kolya and get back from there alive, please, be so kind as to let me know if he's alive.
I found Kolya.
Judging by the expression on your face, I fear for the worst.
Yes, he got killed in the Dead City.
So, that's where he went alone. Yes, he liked to take risks. Well, God rest his soul... Did he find what he was looking for?
I doubt it. I found nothing unusual on him.
It's a pity. Well, stalker, thank you for coming. Kolya left a little money with me to look after. He no longer needs it, so you can have it.
How are the valiant soldiers of the Zone doing?

Well, just well... We received an order from the mainland to test an all-purpose weapon. Supposedly, "to fine tune this universal tactical machine of the future to operate under simulated combat conditions." They're bent. What will they use as a simulation - shooting of wild boars at the military post or something? In such cases a good old AK-74 will suffice. However, I have an order - so I must obey. The guns look quite interesting. Like a normal AK, but it has so many features, that it will blow your mind. Just the sights alone. The boxes of equipment we got - loads of them! As for me - well, as usually, I keep selling gear to stalkers. I promote, so to speak, unification, he-he. Why don't you take one, and then, in the blink of an eye, you will have a new AK to go. If you hesitate, soon enough you might find yourself being ridiculed for using that dated weapon of yours.
